subject: Maybe I'll Live
event:
Well, at least I have the Jets.  This week.

Gang Green eked one out against Pittsburgh, though they drew it out till the last play, and for a while there it felt as though I was about to have a second dagger thrust through my heart.  A good road win against a tough opponent (though not nearly as tough as when Troy is in).  The offense looked better than it has the last two weeks (hard to look worse), especially Sanchez.  The D did well at times as well... the safety was great... but letting the Steelers drive down the field like that in the final minute left me with my heart in my throat.  No way they should make that 3rd-and-24.

As for the Giants game... I am still in shock.  Sickening.

I have never hated the Eagles the way I hate the Cowboys, despite them beating us so often these past few years.  But I think I'm getting there.  Philadelphia replacing Donovan McNabb, a good guy who took a lot of undeserved abuse, with Michael Vick, a not-so-good guy who has not gotten nearly as much abuse as he deserves, has definitely colored my feelings... which makes today even more difficult to swallow.  A shattering loss, I fear.  I don't know if the Giants will recover.  And Vick... what can you say?  Sometimes the bad guys win.

comments.article:
George
It was more the special teams failures that cost the Giants this time .
comments.subject: Special teams

comments.article:
I don't know. Sure, the punt return won it, but I think the game was already lost by then. The Iggles had all the momemntum going into overtime.

There were three huge fuck-ups before that. The first TD of the Phillie combeack, when that tight end rumbled down half the field after Phillips missed the tackle. The on-sides kick, which the Giants were not at all prepared for. And that horrible false start on David Diehl when the Giants were trying to run out the clock.
comments.subject: Re: Special teams

comments.article:
"Sometimes the bad guys win".

*thinks back on ASOIAF books*

Indeed.

I know what you mean about not hating other teams as much as the Cowgirls. However, the team that gets close to that for me is the Giants. I'm an Eagles fan born and raised outside Philly and am now living deep in Giants territory for work. Oh that victory was sweet, can't wait to go to work on Monday!

But Vick as a bad guy who hasn't gotten what he deserved? He's spent a goodly amount of time in jail and lost millions for what he did. There are men playing in the NFL that have killed people.
comments.subject: Lighten Up George!

comments.article:
I agree with this completely. He did his time and seems to have reformed. If anything, I find it encouraging that our penal system may have worked, this once. There ARE men playing in the NFL that have killed people, and others that are habitual offenders.

Vick SEEMS to have changed, for the better, and I think it would be wrong to deny him a second chance when so many others were given one.
comments.subject: Re: Lighten Up George!

comments.article:
For the record, I'm an Eagles fan.

At the beginning of the season, I despaired of the team's chances - I was upset with Reid for trading McNabb, who I thought had another year or two left in him and didn't deserve much of the abuse he got over the past 3 or 4 seasons. I was even more upset that Reid traded McNabb away for practically nothing when Kolb seemed like a substandard QB at best - I expected the team to end with a losing record and be in for years of "rebuilding" until they could get a good QB.

But then Kolb got hurt and Vick came in. And now, while I still think many Philadelphians vastly underrated McNabb, Vick seems a bit better - he doesn't throw interceptions as much, and he's FAST. We'll have to see if he has the same postseason failures as McNabb did, but my initial instinct is to say that the team has improved this year, much to my surprise.

Oh, and I'm with you on hating the Cowboys. I couldn't help but enjoy watching them lose so many games this year.

McNabb definitely would not have been able to orchestrate that final drive like Vick did.  He would not have got anywhere near as far on his feet on those short passes would have been everyone in their ankles.

Nine parts mess, one part magic.

It applies to everything, really.

Oh, and while I am venting... DeSean Jackson is also a dick.  That stunt of running along the goal line prancing and waving the ball instead of just taking it in for the winning TD was classless.  A trash move.
Agreed.  At first I thought he was trying to avoid a defender, but the more times I see the reply, the more I'm convinced he was just showing off.

Gah that was an awful loss for the Giants. I've teetered over the years on whom I hate more: G-Men or Eagles. For some reason I've never been able to have the hate I'm supposed to for the Skins. But the Eagles with Vick and Jackson has made me lean heavy in their direction.

George you must HATE kickers. I remember that game back in 2003 when Matt Bryant kicked the kickoff out of bounds in the waning seconds of the gale which put the ball on the 40 and Dallas was able to tie the game in the last second. They then won in OT and I won a bet against some Giants fan. :p

I'm glad the Jets won. I have a nightmare where Ben Roethisberger plays Michael Vick in the Douche Bowl. I'd rather see the Patriots win another Super Bowl than see that!
comments.subject: I rooted hard for the G-Men today

comments.article: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QDeErwOREik&feature=player_embedded

Re: I rooted hard for the G-Men today
Re: I rooted hard for the G-Men today
Re: I rooted hard for the G-Men today
Re: I rooted hard for the G-Men today

comments.article:
So I work at fedex and had to work sunday morning because of the christmas season, and I didn't sleep at all the night before. I watched most of the game and at the 8 minute mark on the fourth quarter I believe the score was 31-10.

I was so tired I thought, "Well the giants defense can hold them, and I'm about to pass out. I trust the giants."

I woke up and it was like a bad dream. I just want to go back to bed. =_=

I still believe in the Giants, one day we will get our revenge!. . . but not today.
But that game with the Eagles was a show.
comments.subject: Jets are helping out my Ravens...

comments.article:
I loathe Michael Vick. I have no words to describe how much.

I'm a Falcons fan, and I'd love more than I can say for the Falcons to knock the Eagles out of the playoffs. Payback for the loss earlier in the season.
I'm a Falcon's fan also and I'm so with you on this.

Sometimes the good guys lose. My Potomac Drainage Basin Indigenous People (maybe in 50 years they'll change the name to something less racist) were beaten by the Cowboys, oh how it hurts. At least I was on a plane, and wasn't able to witness this.
I kinda like Michael Vick.

I disagree with you on Vick. He did something incredibly terrible but also came from a culture where it was viewed as okay. It's also woken him up to achieving his full potential. What can I say, I like stories where the bad guys have a chance to earn a bit of redemption. What Philly did to McNabb was horrible, but I'm also happy they had to swallow their pride (and money) with Kolb and start Vick. (Lifelong Giants fan though, and was still sickened by the game).

The refs could've called several pass interference calls on the Jets that they let slide, especially the one near the endzone on the last drive. And I do think Polamalu would've made the difference in this game. And that safety never should have happened. Nor the opening kickoff TD.

Hmmm...I'm sure I could come up with more excuses, but I'll leave it at that since the Steelers still clinched a playoff spot.
comments.subject: Sour Grapes

comments.article: ...It's been 9 hours since the game ended and I still feel like throwing up.  You're right.  This is almost as painful as the 49er game a few years back.
comments.subject: Throwing up...

comments.article:
This Giants loss was a real soul-crusher. People are going to compare it to the Pisarcik fumble, but I don't think it even comes close. This was literally a comedy of errors (less comedic for a Giants fan); dissect the last half of the 4th quarter and the number of things the Giants could have done to dodge this bullet just pile up.

If the punter still has a job next week, that'll be a miracle by itself... but really, the failure to have the hands team out for a possible onside kick is criminal.

I agree though, the thought of Patriots/Eagles II makes me sick to my stomach.
comments.subject: Pisarcik thanks you, coach Coughlin!

comments.article:
Your tears taste delicious to me.

As a Pats fan, this is SMALL compensation for what your Giants did in 2008.

:) :) :)
comments.subject: Super Bowl

comments.article:
Yes. It is.

We'll always have Paris. And David Tyree.
comments.subject: Re: Super Bowl

comments.article:
The Jets won. That's good. But once again Rex has overblown the outcome. Without Polamalu it was easier for the offense to perform well. This victory does not show that they are resilient. The defense had a fair performance, but even at the end the Steelers dropped a certain TD. Rex has to stop overstating their successes. Hasn't he learned that overstating Revis last year is the main reason that there was no Revis Island this season?

The Giants lost. There was no reason for the offense to bog down other than simply horrible play calling. Just two more first downs in the fourth quarter and they would have won despite the poor defense. Fewell needs to light a fire under the guys who don't maintain scheme discipline. It has become endemic to this defense. Guys suddenly go off the reservation and generally at the worst possible time with horrendous results. His choice of personnel and play calling in the fourth was also suspect. I wonder if some guys were cramping or fatigued or injured. We saw Tuck trying to cover the TE on a seam route and JPP got no pressure. Oh, and was Umenyiora on the field during the last eight minutes? Every time I saw a loss of contain I kept looking to see if he was out of position, but I couldn't even find him.

Somebody please tell me who in the organization is responsible for Dodge being on the non-practice squad past the fifth game? And why couldn't the Giants get somebody, anybody who doesn't make fielding punts an adventure?

The talking heads in NY were saying that if the Jets didn't make the playoffs it would be a colossal collapse rivaling the '07 Mets. I wonder what it will be if the Giants screw the pooch?
comments.subject: NY Fan

comments.article: I can't complain, since Michael Vick pretty much singlehandedly won me my fantasy football playoff game. (Also, I have to admit I like the Eagles a lot better than the Giants.  Sorry, but the 1991 NFC Championship game still leaves a bitter taste in my mouth.)

I was watching that game and in the first half I thought of you and how happy you must have been that the Giants were basically keeping Vick from doing anything. It was like Vick wasn't even playing the game. I was horrified during the last 10 mins of the game. I am a die hard Bears fan so I am used to disappointment but that game blew my mind. I absolutely hate Vick because of what he did to those poor animals.( I am also a pit bull lover) I was hoping someone would really hurt the guy and take him out of the game for good. Oh well, maybe next time.
comments.subject: Vick disgusts me

comments.article: I said before Vick was allowed to play again;I bet he gets sacked ultra hard by anyone who owns a dog.I relieve my feelings by shouting "this one's for Fido" every time he's hit hard.It's not just the dog abuse,it's he was mixed up with heavy gamblers.Can he be trusted not to throw a game?

I think the '03 playoff loss to the Niners was worse.

What kills me is that both were capped by HORRENDOUS special teams play.
comments.subject: Personally...

comments.article:
Since I started reading this journal I've taken an interest in New York football, and after living in Pittsburgh for so many years I'm a Steelers fan. Despite the rough Sunday on those accounts, my roots speak louder:

LIONS WIN ON THE ROAD!

I don't see how anyone outside of Tampa can be upset after that.
comments.subject: Silver Lining

comments.article:
As an Eagles fan it was a good outcome. It was besmirched by the dog killer, who is also responsible for ruining my normal football enjoyment. I can't cheer for him, so there is that constant tension.

Really was tactless and unjust of the coach to throw the punter under the bus, his mistake was only the final one.

In our mutual disdain for Vick, we find common ground.
comments.subject: Giants-Eagles

comments.article: What's worse, Ron Mexico or the Dog Executioner? I try to seperate the artist from his work, i really do, but sometimes these matharchoyds make it prettyyyy hard...
comments.subject: Vick
